title: The Reason for Today's Sharp Aluminum Price Hike (November 10, 2025)
summary: Aluminum prices rose sharply by about 0.7-1.2% reaching $2,856-$2,860 per ton due to global alumina and bauxite supply shortages caused by disruptions in Guinea and Brazil. Production cuts in China and Australia, combined with increased demand from green industries and economic stimulus, are driving a global deficit and pushing prices higher.

title: Aluminum Prices Surge Amid U.S. Government Reopening Hopes
summary: Aluminum prices on the London Metal Exchange surged 1.7% to $2,895 per ton driven by optimism over a potential U.S. government reopening. The market remains strong due to Chinese capacity curbs and resilient demand, with analysts predicting a market deficit of 1.8 million tons this year despite high producer margins potentially limiting further price rises.

title: Aluminum rises on the outlook of reopening the US government
summary: Aluminum prices rose 1.7% to $2,895 per ton on the London Metal Exchange, supported by optimism about a U.S. government reopening. Production cuts in China and sustained global demand contribute to a supply deficit of around 1.8 million tons this year, though high producer margins may cap further price increases.

title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News - Trading Economics
summary: Aluminum prices rose to $2,884.10 per ton on November 10, 2025, up 0.95% from the previous day, marking a 4.13% increase over the past month and a 12.05% rise year-over-year. Prices reached a three-year high amid tight supply and China's production caps, with forecasts expecting prices to reach $3,015.51 per ton within 12 months.

title: EU CBAM Adjustments Transform Aluminium Pricing Markets
summary: The European Union's Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM), effective January 1, 2026, will impose carbon-based pricing on aluminum imports, reshaping global aluminum trade by linking prices to environmental compliance. This new regulatory framework introduces certificate costs based on embedded carbon emissions, significantly impacting international aluminum market dynamics.

title: Aluminum Eases from 3-Year High
summary: Aluminum futures in the UK fell to $2,850 per tonne from a three-year high amid soft manufacturing PMIs in the US and China, though supply concerns kept prices 12% higher year-to-date. China's annual aluminum output cap of 45 million tons is expected to be breached next year, and smelters face challenges expanding in Indonesia due to energy costs and regulations. Issues at key smelters, including Iceland's Grundartangi and Alcoa's Kwinana refinery, also pressured supply.

title: EU CBAM Adjustments Transform Aluminium Pricing Markets
summary: The EU's Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM) is reshaping global aluminum pricing, favoring regions with low-carbon production like Norway, Iceland, Canada, and Brazil. High-carbon producers in China, India, and Russia face increased costs and competitive disadvantages, prompting shifts in production and investment toward cleaner technologies.

title: Aluminum Premium Reaches Record High in the US Due to Tariffs and Global Squeeze
summary: Record-high aluminum premiums in the US are driven by steep import tariffs and a global supply shortage. The physical market is experiencing tight conditions, with limited supply and increased demand pushing premiums to unprecedented levels.

title: Premiums for Aluminum in U.S. Reach Record Highs
summary: US aluminum premiums have hit record highs due to import tariffs and a global supply squeeze. The situation is impacting the physical market, with producers and consumers facing increased costs and limited availability.

title: Alcoa, Ball, and Unilever Pioneer Carbon-Free Aluminum in Consumer Packaging
summary: Alcoa, Ball, and Unilever have launched the world's first consumer personal and home care packaging using ELYSIS carbon-free aluminum smelting technology. This innovation eliminates greenhouse gas emissions from aluminum production by using inert anode technology, producing oxygen instead of CO2, and marks a significant step toward decarbonizing the aluminum industry and mainstreaming low-carbon materials.

title: UAE Delivers First Batch of Low-Carbon Aluminium Powered by Nuclear Energy from Barakah
summary: Emirates Global Aluminium and Emirates Nuclear Energy Company have delivered the UAE's first batch of low-carbon aluminium produced using clean electricity from the Barakah Nuclear Energy Plant. The product, branded MinimAL, represents a milestone in industrial sustainability and highlights nuclear energy's role in decarbonizing heavy industries by providing constant carbon-free power.

title: Manufacturer unveils innovative product that could transform future braking systems with recycled aluminum
summary: Brembo has launched brake calipers made from 100% recycled aluminum, reducing lifecycle planet-heating pollution by 70%. This breakthrough demonstrates that high-performance automotive components can be produced sustainably, leveraging aluminum's infinite recyclability and widespread availability to lower carbon emissions significantly.

title: Can circular aluminium provide a blueprint for a post-plastic world?
summary: Circular aluminium offers significant sustainability benefits due to its infinite recyclability and lower energy requirements compared to virgin aluminum production. While challenges remain in replacing plastics globally, aluminium's established recycling infrastructure and environmental advantages position it as a key material for advancing a sustainable circular economy.

title: Vedanta Aluminium Expands Low-Carbon Portfolio with Launch of Restora Production at BALCO
summary: Vedanta Aluminium has expanded its low-carbon product portfolio by launching Restora production at BALCO, reflecting ongoing efforts to enhance ecological restoration and community stewardship through sustainable aluminum manufacturing practices.

title: US November Scrap Market Trading Flat, Sources Say
summary: The US scrap market is trading flat in November, with most grades seeing sideways pricing. Mill-owned brokers are buying at October levels, and dealers are accepting these prices despite concerns about winter weather and reduced scrap flows. Some sources predict prices may rise this winter if steelmakers increase production.

title: US Raw Steel Production Is Up 1.0 Percent - Week 46, 2025
summary: US domestic raw steel production rose 1.0% for the week ending November 8, 2025, reaching 1.758 million net tons with a capacity utilization rate of 76.7%. This marks a 9.1% increase compared to the same period last year, reflecting continued growth in the sector.

title: Steel Holds November Pullback
summary: Steel rebar futures in China fell to CNY 3,040 per tonne due to lower demand and increased trade protectionism. Exports from China dropped 12.5% year-on-year in October, and the construction PMI hit a record low, signaling ongoing sector contraction.

title: Steel Prices in the Second Week of November 2025
summary: Global steel markets showed mixed price movements in the second week of November 2025, with some products increasing and others declining. The report highlights regional differences in price trends and market sentiment.

title: Steel Prices Down As Ship Recycling Slows
summary: Global steel prices are falling as ship recycling activity slows, particularly in South Asia. Prices in Pakistan and India have dropped below USD 400/LDT, with weak demand and limited supply contributing to the downturn.

title: JSW Steel Ltd: Live Stock Update and Price as of November 11, 2025
summary: JSW Steel Ltd shares rose 0.10% to ₹1,181.20 on November 11, 2025. The update reflects current market sentiment and minor gains in the company's stock price.

title: AISI: Weekly raw steel production ticks up
summary: US mills produced an estimated 1,758,000 short tons of raw steel in the week ending November 8, 2025, up 1.0% from the previous week. The mill capability utilization rate was 76.7% last week, up from 76.0% the week prior and 9.1% higher than the same week a year earlier. Year-to-date production now stands at 77,228,000 short tons, 3.1% higher than the same period in 2024.

title: US raw steel production is up 1.0 percent - week 46, 2025
summary: According to the American Iron and Steel Institute (AISI), US domestic raw steel production for the week ending November 8, 2025, was 1.758 million net tons with a capacity utilization rate of 76.7%. Year-to-date adjusted production through November 8, 2025, was 77.228 million net tons at a capacity utilization rate of 77.0%, representing a 3.1% increase from the same period last year.

title: Rising mill output creates ferrous market anticipation
summary: US mills produced nearly 1.76 million tons of raw steel in the week ending November 8, 2025, at a 76.7% capacity utilization rate, representing a 9.1% jump from the comparable week in 2024. Year-to-date production of more than 77.2 million tons represents a 3.1% increase compared with 74.9 million tons made in the same period last year, with prices for recycled steel expected to remain in a steady-to-downward range.

title: Vale gearing up to meet Indian demand as China steel output stagnates
summary: Brazilian miner Vale is preparing to meet rising iron ore demand from India, which could double its steel production by the end of the decade. This shift reflects changing global steel dynamics as China's steel output stagnates.

title: South Korea confronts global steel barriers as US, EU and Canada tighten rules
summary: South Korea's trade ministry held a joint public-private meeting to assess the impact of global protectionist measures targeting steel, including US Section 232 tariffs and Tariff Rate Quota systems in the EU and Canada. The ministry announced a Steel Industry Advancement Plan that includes stronger domestic safeguards and financial support for affected producers.

title: Ecomondo 2025: European steel industry between climate challenge and economic sustainability
summary: This article discusses the European steel industry's efforts to balance climate challenges with economic sustainability, focusing on decarbonization and energy issues. It highlights the industry's ongoing transition towards greener practices amid regulatory and market pressures.

title: The GO Scheme - Certifying Green Steel and other Aussie low carbon products
summary: The GO Scheme is introduced as a certification program for green steel and other low-carbon products in Australia. The scheme aims to promote transparency and encourage sustainable steel production practices in the region.

title: AM/NS India accelerates circularity in steelmaking
summary: ArcelorMittal Nippon Steel India (AM/NS India) has released its Sustainability Report for FY2024-2025, outlining measurable targets to enhance circularity in steelmaking. The report details initiatives aimed at reducing environmental impact and improving resource efficiency in steel production.

title: Climate Club release Members Statement and Global Pledge to grow near-zero and low-emissions steel and cement markets
summary: The Climate Club, comprising 46 members, has issued a 2025 statement and launched a global pledge to expand near-zero and low-emissions steel and cement markets. This initiative underscores the commitment of industry stakeholders to accelerate decarbonization in heavy industries.

title: Grasberg Accident Investigation Concludes, LME Copper Surged Overnight
summary: LME copper settled at $10,874.5/mt, up 1.68%, after opening at $10,820/mt and reaching a high of $10,903/mt. Freeport Indonesia completed its investigation into the slurry leakage incident at Grasberg copper-gold mine, with the Big Gossan and Deep Mill Level Zone mines resuming operations at the end of October.

title: Copper prices drop on Fed policy uncertainty and Codelco supply
summary: Copper prices extended losses on Tuesday, falling as much as 2.4% to around $10,855 per tonne on the LME, pressured by renewed uncertainty over US interest rates and easing supply concerns from Chilean miner Codelco. The US dollar reached its highest level since May, further weighing on metals that had surged in anticipation of a US-China trade truce.

title: Copper climbs on US shutdown deal, supply tightness
summary: Copper prices climbed on Tuesday as a potential resolution to the US federal government shutdown lifted market sentiment, with the three-month copper contract up 0.24% at $10,822 per ton. Fresh production data showing reduced output at Chile's Codelco reinforced expectations of tighter supply next year.

title: 3 ASX copper shares soaring amid 28% surge in commodity price this year
summary: ASX copper shares are benefiting from a 28% surge in the commodity price this year to US$5.08 per pound on Tuesday, driven by higher demand amid the global energy transition. Copper has been supported by its designation as a critical material for the US economy and national security, as well as a weaker US dollar.

title: Copper Rises as Risk Appetite Improves
summary: Copper futures climbed back above $5 per pound on Monday, reaching a one-week high as risk appetite strengthened amid optimism that the US government shutdown may soon end. The red metal also benefited from a weaker dollar and the Trump administration's addition of copper to its list of critical materials for the US economy.

title: Copper Prices Rise Amid Uncertainty Over U.S. Tariffs
summary: US President Trump has indicated a possible reconsideration of copper tariffs, which could tighten global supply outside the United States and support copper prices.

title: Grasberg Accident Investigation Concludes, LME Copper Surged Overnight
source: SMM Copper Morning Meeting Minutes / Metal.com
summary: Freeport Indonesia completed its investigation into the slurry leakage incident at the Grasberg copper-gold mine, which caused worker deaths. Operations at unaffected mines in the Grasberg area have resumed, while LME copper prices surged overnight, reflecting market reactions to the news.

title: Copper climbs on US shutdown deal, supply tightness
summary: Copper prices rose due to optimism over a potential resolution to the US federal government shutdown and concerns about supply tightness. Production fell 26% at a mine jointly operated by Glencore and Anglo American, while BHP's Escondida mine output increased by 17%, highlighting mixed production trends amid supply concerns.

title: Fast tracking one of Australia's largest copper resources
summary: Caravel Minerals signed a non-binding MoU with Adani’s Kutch Copper to advance the Caravel copper project in Western Australia. Early production is expected to yield 62,000–71,000 tonnes of payable copper annually, with supply planned to Adani’s large smelter in India, strengthening the copper supply chain between Australia and India.

title: Vedanta to invest $1.5bn in Zambia's expanding copper sector
summary: Vedanta Resources announced a $1.5 billion investment to increase production at its Konkola copper mine in Zambia to 300,000 tons by 2031. This investment supports Zambia’s national target to raise copper output to 3 million tons by 2031 amid rising global demand driven by energy transition and AI sector growth.

title: 3 ASX copper shares soaring amid 28% surge in commodity price this year
summary: ASX-listed copper shares are benefiting from a 28% increase in copper prices this year, reaching US$5.08 per pound. The rise is driven by higher demand from the global energy transition, US government designation of copper as critical for national security, and potential regulatory changes in China targeting copper refining capacity.

title: Teck Anglo American Merger Creates Copper Production Powerhouse
summary: The merger between Teck and Anglo American combines six copper operations, creating a top-five global copper producer. The integration of Teck's Quebrada Blanca and Anglo American's Collahuasi mines in Chile is expected to optimize operations and potentially rival the world's largest copper producing regions.

title: ARENA commits $25.3 million to continue SunDrive's copper solar cell breakthrough
summary: Australia’s ARENA has committed $25.3 million to advance SunDrive’s copper metallisation technology for solar cells, aiming to provide a silver-free alternative amid rising silver prices. This investment supports scaling up production of copper-based solar technology, contributing to clean energy innovation.

title: Surge Copper Highlights Strengthening Policy Environment for Critical Minerals Development in Canada
summary: Surge Copper welcomes measures in Budget 2025 that support critical minerals development in Canada, with the Berg Project positioned to benefit from infrastructure initiatives and federal-provincial support. The project features a large-scale copper and molybdenum resource with low-carbon, hydro-powered design aligned with national priorities for responsible resource development.

title: Critical Minerals Report (11.09.2025): Financing Critical Minerals 2.0 Through Government Equity and Private Capital
summary: Copper prices have reached a record $11,200 per tonne, reflecting tight supply conditions driven by demand from electric vehicles and power grids. The report highlights supply chain concerns, including Glencore's potential closure of its Horne copper smelter in Quebec, Canada's largest copper metal operation, due to environmental upgrade requirements.

title: Nickel Price Collapse Forces Market Repricing as Oversupply Weak Demand Challenge Producers
summary: The nickel market is undergoing severe structural adjustment with prices collapsing to around US$15,000 per tonne in mid-2025 due to oversupply and weak demand. Macroeconomic factors such as US dollar strength and tariffs on imports from major producers like Indonesia and Russia are adding complexity, driving supply chain realignment and creating distinct pricing mechanisms based on source jurisdiction.

title: Nickel Maintains Muted Momentum
summary: Nickel futures in the UK fell to about $15,000 per tonne in November, trading at the lower end of a narrow range since June amid oversupply. Indonesia's nickel sector expansion and ore export ban have led to supply surpluses despite quota cuts. Demand is mixed, with muted stainless steel purchasing offset by increased nickel use in electric vehicles.

title: On November 11, the SMM #1 refined nickel price was 119,400-123,200 yuan/mt
summary: The SMM #1 refined nickel price ranged from 119,400 to 123,200 yuan per metric ton on November 11, with an average price of 121,300 yuan/mt, marking a slight increase of 100 yuan/mt from the previous day.

title: [SMM Nickel Sulphate Daily Review] November 11 Nickel Salt Prices Slightly Declined
summary: On November 11, the SMM battery-grade nickel sulphate index price was 28,285 yuan/mt, with a slight decline in the quotation range for battery-grade nickel sulphate.

title: LME nickel price hikes slightly on Nov 11, remaining stable
summary: The international nickel price remained stable on November 11, with the three-month futures price on the London Metal Exchange (LME) slightly rising, reflecting a steady market condition.

title: Nickel Industries targets US$1 billion EBITDA by 2026
summary: Australia-listed nickel miner and processor Nickel Industries Limited aims to achieve US$1 billion EBITDA by 2026, signaling strong growth ambitions amid current market conditions.

title: Aqua Metals partners with Westwin to strengthen US nickel supply chain
summary: Aqua Metals signed a non-binding letter of intent with Westwin Elements to supply up to 1,000 metric tons of recycled nickel carbonate annually starting in 2027. This partnership aims to build one of the first fully domestic recycled nickel supply chains in the US, reducing reliance on imports and supporting clean energy systems. The deal is valued at around $12 million annually based on current nickel prices.

title: Aqua Metals and Westwin Elements Sign LOI for U.S.-Produced Nickel Carbonate Supply
summary: Aqua Metals announced a non-binding Letter of Intent with Westwin Elements to supply up to 1,000 metric tons of recycled battery-grade nickel carbonate annually starting in 2027. The agreement follows successful qualification of Aqua Metals' nickel carbonate product and aims to establish one of the first domestic sources of nickel carbonate to support US industrial and battery manufacturing needs.

title: Aqua Metals Westwin Partnership Creates US Nickel Supply
summary: Aqua Metals and Westwin have partnered to create America's first integrated nickel battery recycling supply chain, aiming to produce 500 to 1,000 metric tons of recycled nickel carbonate annually by 2027. This closed-loop system converts battery waste into new battery production feedstock, enhancing US nickel supply security amid growing electric vehicle adoption and reducing dependence on foreign imports.

title: Nickel Maintains Muted Momentum
summary: Nickel futures in the UK fell to around $15,000 per tonne in November, trading at the lower end of a narrow range since June due to oversupply. Indonesia's nickel sector expansion and export restrictions have led to supply surpluses despite a 35% reduction in mining quotas. Nickel stockpiles at LME warehouses increased by 90,000 tonnes this year, with muted stainless steel demand offset by higher nickel use in electric vehicles.

title: Western Mines launching high-powered MLEM survey
summary: Western Mines Group is conducting a moving loop electromagnetic survey in mid-November to aid targeting of drillholes at the Mulga Tank Ni-Cu-Co-PGE Project. The survey aims to extend coverage over mineralized areas with significant nickel sulphide mineralization, supporting ongoing exploration and resource expansion efforts into early 2026.

title: Nickel Industries targets US$1 billion EBITDA by 2026
summary: Nickel Industries aims to achieve US$1 billion EBITDA by 2026, reflecting growth ambitions in the nickel sector. The company is expanding production capacity amid strong demand for nickel, particularly for battery and stainless steel applications.

title: Breakthrough Tech Yields 99% Pure Nickel, Cobalt
summary: A new electrochemical process has been developed that produces 99% pure nickel and cobalt while minimizing chemical usage and wastewater production. This technology enhances purity and recovery efficiency, potentially benefiting nickel production sustainability and capacity.

title: Aqua Metals and Westwin Elements Sign LOI for U.S.-Produced Nickel Carbonate Supply
summary: Aqua Metals and Westwin Elements have signed a letter of intent to create one of the first domestic sources of battery-grade nickel carbonate in the U.S., using advanced recycling technologies. The collaboration aims to strengthen the circular supply chain for critical minerals and reduce dependence on imports, supporting sustainable and secure domestic manufacturing.

title: Recycling Technology Achieves 99% Purity of Nickel and Cobalt
summary: A research team affiliated with UNIST has developed a new recycling technology that recovers over 95% of nickel and cobalt from waste batteries, achieving up to 99% purity. This eco-friendly method could significantly reduce the environmental impact of battery production and support the circular economy.

title: New Recycling Tech Recovers Nearly Pure Nickel and Cobalt from Old Batteries
summary: Researchers have unveiled an innovative recycling technology that extracts 99% pure nickel and cobalt from spent electric vehicle batteries. The breakthrough could help meet the growing demand for sustainable battery materials and reduce reliance on virgin mining.

title: Nornickel Upgrades Catalyst in Sulphur Program
summary: Nornickel has begun replacing the vanadium catalyst in its Sulphur Program at the Nadezhda Smelter, aiming to improve efficiency and reduce environmental impact. This upgrade is part of ongoing efforts to enhance the sustainability of nickel production processes.

title: Tenaris S.A. Announces Share Buyback Reaching 5.01% of Voting Rights
summary: Tenaris announced that the company is expected to report earnings on November 11, 2025, before market open. This earnings report serves as a clear catalyst for traders and investors.

title: Tenaris to Commence a USD 600 million Second Tranche of its USD 1.2 Billion Share Buyback Program
summary: Tenaris initiated the second tranche of its USD 1.2 billion Share Buyback Program with a non-discretionary buyback agreement with a financial institution to purchase up to USD 600 million of its shares, starting November 3, 2025, and concluding by April 30, 2026. The purchased shares will eventually be canceled, demonstrating the company's strong financial position and commitment to returning value to shareholders.

title: Prysmian Upgrades 2025 Guidance
summary: Prysmian raised its full-year 2025 guidance after reporting strong third-quarter results with revenue of €5.03 billion, 3% above consensus. The Italian cable manufacturer posted organic growth of 9.2%, beating the 7.8% forecast, with particularly strong performance in its Renewable Transmission and Power Grids segments.

title: Prysmian Named As Preferred Bidder For Major UK High Voltage Energy Interconnection Project
summary: Prysmian was named as the preferred bidder for a major UK high voltage energy interconnection project. This represents another significant contract win for the Italian cable manufacturer in the transmission infrastructure sector.
